statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Arizona State 66, Oregon 56
article.story: TEMPE, Ariz. (AP) -- Steve Moore has had bigger games. Just not with so much riding on every shot. Moore scored 17 of his 22 points in the second half, leading Arizona State's rally from a 13-point deficit, and the Sun Devils beat Oregon 66-56 Saturday night to virtually lock up a berth in the Pac-10 tournament field. The Sun Devils (18-9, 7-8) have three games left -- two against ranked teams -- and probably need a good conference-tournament performance to ensure making the NCAA field for the second time in three years. "It was real big," Moore said. "People are already writing us off, people saying that we're playing our way out of the tournament. But coach (Rob Evans) was very optimistic. He was like, 'If they're saying we're playing our way out of the tournament, we must be in." Ike Diogu was 9-of-15 from the field and Moore 9-of-16, helping the Sun Devils overcome a spotty team performance -- they shot only 38 percent, but matched a season-low with six turnovers to Oregon's 19 and had nine steals. "The last 10 minutes was the best defense we have played in a while," Evans said. "That's the way you win ballgames." Diogu had 23 points, but missed six free throws two nights after missing a career-worst seven in a 75-73 win over Oregon State. Malik Hairston had 18 points and 11 rebounds, and Aaron Brooks scored 17 points for the Ducks (12-11, 4-10). Brooks scored 12 in the second half, but couldn't keep his team from losing for the eighth time in nine games. "It got away from us," Ducks coach Ernie Kent said. "You can't have 17 turnovers with your four starters alone. That's going to be tough to beat anybody." Hairston and Mitch Platt had three-point plays as Oregon opened a 38-25 lead 1:20 into the second half. Diogu started Arizona State's rally by dunking an offensive rebound, and Moore had three straight baskets in a 1:36 span when the Sun Devils caught up, tying the game at 42 with a 3-pointer with 11:57 remaining. Jason Braxton gave Arizona State its first lead, 50-49, when he stole the ball from Brooks on the dribble and dunked with 8:09 left. The Sun Devils took over for good at 54-53 on Diogu's short jumper with 5:33 to go. Moore made a baseline runner, Diogu scored again and Moore opened a 60-53 lead with a 14-footer with 2:30 left. "Ike Diogu came out and played hard, and it's like they hit another gear in the half, midway through, and we couldn't hold them down after that," Brooks said. Hairston scored eight points in the game's first 2:54, and the Ducks raced to a 16-6 lead on Jordan Kent's basket with 13:47 left. Arizona State, which was 2-for-12 over the same period, began to shoot better and cut its deficit to 22-21 when Bryson Krueger made a 3-pointer with 6:22 to go. But Bryce Taylor made two 3-pointers after that, and the Ducks led 30-25 at halftime. "We talked in the locker room," Diogu said. "We knew what was at stake, and we just came out and played like we're capable of playing. (Moore) was just unbelievable out there today. He had probably his best game as a Sun Devil. He was amazing. "He singlehandedly brought us back, willed us in to win."
